Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, Grand or Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky dark brown; traces of two pairs of concentric bands in added white; exterior: slip partly worn; two concentric streaky brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 14 is written on a paper label glued to the interior surface of the sherd. The numbers 8, 737 and 14 are written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. Bands on the cul of chalices appear as early as 610BC and last until circa 550BC. Large chalices are typical in the Mature Animal Style, Grand and Chalice Styles.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 680, no. 388)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0695) (phase 2)
